abstract_summ: The emergence and rapid global spread of SARS-CoV-2 mark the third such identification of a novel coronavirus capable of causing severe, potentially fatal disease in humans in the 21(st) century.The purpose of this review was to summarize the in-vitro and in-vivo efficacy of these drugs on Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS-CoV-2) and related viruses (SARS and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome) and evaluate their potential for re-purposing them in the management of COVID-19.The recent emergence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) from the Hubei province in China in late 2019 demonstrates the epidemic potential of coronaviruses.The pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by SARS-CoV-2 has posed a severe threat to global public health.The SARS-CoV-2 is a new human coronavirus candidate recently detected in China that is now reported in people on inhabited continents.The model indicates that Wuhan quarantine measures were effective but that alternative virus forms (gut tropism) and a second propagation route (through environment) was present.
title_summ: A new transmission route for the propagation of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirusBattling COVID-19: using old weapons for a new enemyCOVID-19: Knowns, Unknowns, and QuestionsGenetic diversity and evolution of SARS-CoV-2The SARS-CoV-2 seroprevalence is the key factor for deconfinement in FranceAchilles' heel of the killer virus: the highly important molecular targets for hitting SARS-CoV-2 that causes COVID-19Rapid establishment of laboratory diagnostics for the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 in Bavaria, Germany, February 2020SARS-CoV-2: A New Song Recalls an Old MelodyPangolins Harbor SARS-CoV-2-Related CoronavirusesSARS-CoV-2: Combating Coronavirus EmergenceThe SARS-CoV-2 outbreak from a one health perspectiveIs COVID-19 the first pandemic that evolves into a panzootic?Using heat to kill SARS-CoV-2.Understanding COVID-19 in Nepal.
title_abstract_phrases: SARS-CoV-2: Combating Coronavirus EmergenceThe emergence and rapid global spread of SARS-CoV-2 mark the third such identification of a novel coronavirus capable of causing severe, potentially fatal disease in humans in the 21(st) century.The SARS-CoV-2 outbreak from a one health perspectiveThe SARS-CoV-2 is a new human coronavirus candidate recently detected in China that is now reported in people on inhabited continents.The purpose of this review was to summarize the in-vitro and in-vivo efficacy of these drugs on Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS-CoV-2) and related viruses (SARS and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome) and evaluate their potential for re-purposing them in the management of COVID-19.COVID-19: Knowns, Unknowns, and QuestionsThe recent emergence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) from the Hubei province in China in late 2019 demonstrates the epidemic potential of coronaviruses.The model indicates that Wuhan quarantine measures were effective but that alternative virus forms (gut tropism) and a second propagation route (through environment) was present.Using heat to kill SARS-CoV-2.The current coronavirus pandemic has reached global proportions and requires unparalleled collective and individual efforts to slow its spread.
